item.title: Neighbour constantly smokes weed, 29th July
item.description:
Neighbour smoking cannabis everyday. We can't sleep and we have to close our windows. Reported this already but nothing is done. We have a person on antidepressants and the smoke causes scary side effects.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Crofton Terrace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging Trees into Hydefield Close N21 2PS, 29th July
item.description:
The branches from some trees are overhanging into the road. The problem is on the grass bank between 31 and 32 Hydefield Close N21 2PS. No-one is parking under them. Also, you can see from the photos that if there was to be a strong wind, they could fall onto the parked vehicles nearby.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hydefield Close, Edmonton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins never emptied and rubbish constantly on pavement and road, 29th July
item.description:
Hi! These bins are never emptied, I walk past them almost every day and there's rubbish constantly on the street, today was particularly bad. Please can they just Ben emptied so that the people who live there can hopefully use them properly. I do suspect that this may be an ongoing issue, they constantly leave large items next to their bins and I suspect this kind of behaviour encourages flytipping as well. Thanks!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46, Knowles Hill Crescent, Hither Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mabley green trees - rear of Eastway, 29th July
item.description:
Iâ€™ve lived on Eastway, for nearly 10 years. The trees behind my house were trimmed once, soon after we moved in, but not since. They now overhang into our garden and toward the house. Other nearby trees have been maintained, but not these. Please advise -

item.title: Pertruding hedge, 29th July
item.description:
Hedge oposite my house petruding onto public pathway has now become a stashspot for junkies. Have noticed the same people on multiple ocations 1 looks like he puts something down and the others will come and collect by the looks of it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Homerton Grove, Hackney, London
